review: I have eaten at several CPKs, and this one has, by far, the worst service. Not just for CPK, but some of the worst service I've ever experienced.  This review is based on my last 4 visits, which have taken place over the last 6 months.  On visit one, our very distracted waitress told us (as a reason she'd been away so long) that they'd gotten a new manager and everyone was talking about it. That was literally true. She never refilled our drinks because she was standing in the corner with 3 other employees chatting. Visit two was MUCH better. My fiance and I came in late and sat at the bar. The bartender was on it every step of the way! We had a great time and spent lots more because of it. So, with fond memories of our last visit, we returned a third time. We did not sit at the bar, which was a mistake. The food was good, but the service was minimal. We'd been seated near a table where employees were gathering as they got off work. We got to spend our entire meal listening to them chat about what club in Denver they were going to, and how one of them didn't want to go at all if the rest of their group didn't get off work soon. Not a fun evening. Despite that, we recently returned for a fourth--and final--visit. Our waiter was one of the wort I've ever had. He got us our drinks, and didn't return for almost 10 minutes to take our order. We ordered an appetizer, which took a very long time to arrive. Once our meals arrived, we didn't hear from him again until the check. All of our drinks were empty, and he even walked by once and pointed at them...but never offered to fill them. My fiance ended up taking our glasses to the bartender and getting refills. Our waiter saw this, yet never offered any sort6 of apology. In fact, he never came to our table at all! Once we were done eating, he actually brought us a dessert menu and asked if we'd like anything. We just sort of laughed at him and asked for the check... CPK has great food, though it's a little overpriced. We love it, and will continue to eat there, but not at this location. If you find yourself at this Briargate location, my advice is to not eat there. If you must, ask to sit at the bar.

I haven't had CPK in...years and years. A decade even. What I remember is one step above mall food court pizza. What we got was interesting entree choices (we opted for the tostada pizza, one large easily fed the 3 of us at dinner) and decadent desserts. We went a little over the top on dessert, I must say. All I can tell you is that the seasonal strawberry shortcake looked wonderful, the kid devoured his lemon cake and Blue Bell ice cream quickly, and the tiramisu...oh my favorite dessert was not to be forgotten. Let's just say it needs to be shared (but I didn't). A fun time was had by all. Next time I'll sit outside on the patio. And there WILL be a next time, there were plenty of new pizza combos I'm itching to try. Nice work CPK, you are mall food no more!

I have enjoyed CPK in various other cities and just started frequenting this location since moving to the Springs. The food is always consistently prepared, but this review is for customer service. I had my husband pick up an order on his way back from Denver. Everything went smooth with placing the order and the curbside pickup but once he arrived home and I unpacked the food, there was no plastic ware or napkins. Being in our brand new home without our furniture (including all kitchen items) this posed a problem with 2 pasta dishes to eat! I called the manager and he was extremely apologetic and told me to stop by on a day he was working. They more than made up for their error with a comp card to enjoy whenever we chose and were very gracious about the whole thing. That is what I consider great customer service and a reason to be a repeat customer.
I thought the service was so so.  And  the chips were bad.  Those two thing better they would have gotten a 4 star.
Good food but bad service and a disastrous 20 min waiting for desserts that they did not have. Bad day for cpk

We have had pretty good luck with this CPK.  Service is usually pretty solid.  Last few times has been consistent, but we have had issues about a year ago.   This time, while the did mess up an order (put onions on my pepperoni pizza), but replaced the pie with a new one.  I was happy with the first one.  Manager come over to apologize. Food is always consistent.
Poor service, pizza was not cooked and very dry! Manager was very appologetic.

Great service, friendly staff and the food was prompt. The margarita pizza I had was good. The reason for the missing starts is that the pre-meal bread with olive oil was harder than a 30 year old rock. This means that it was probably a few days old and makes me wonder if all their ingredients are old?

I don't visit CPK very often, but I really enjoyed this experience.  The pizzas and salad were very good and the service was excellent. There was a slight mixup on our order, and they made it right immediately and without question. They were giving roses to mothers on Mother's Day.  Nice! We'll be back.

Great pizza. I know a lot of people hate chains but CPK hit it out of the park. The Sicilian I got was amazing. My son had the cheese and tomato. My wife had the mushroom/sausage/pepperoni and my girls had only a cheese pizza.  Everyone loved them.  Little pricey but the 20 percent military discount was awesome. Will going back

Went for lunch with my wife and daughter-unit Saturday.  Although the restaurant was full we did not have to wait to be seated.  We were seated under a blinking light, very distracting, but were quickly moved when we asked to be. We ordered two salads and a pizza for the three of us.  My daughter-unit is a vegetarian, so we asked for no chicken on the salad and asked for a special base for the pizza. I had a nice Malbec wine that was delightful and not overly expensive. When the food arrived, my salad was as ordered.  The vegetarian salad had chicken in it and the pizza was on the standard crust, not the one requested. They were quick to take the non-vegetarian salad back to the chicken and prepare a fresh one.  We said that we could live with the wrong pizza crust, just make sure we were not charged for the more expensive requested one. "Hold it!" you are saying, they got two out of three things wrong and they still get four stars? Yes.  They were very quick to get a correct salad out.  They made a fresh correct pizza, and when we said that was not necessary, we were eating the wrong one at that point, the manager said it was already in the oven and that they would box it and we could take it home with us.  Oh, did I mention that the manager was sent over by the server when the problem was pointed out? It was fairly obvious that our server was new to the job.  She appeared to be diligent in writing down our order.  We made some casual comment about how the kitchen got it wrong, but she was quick to say that it might have been her entering into the computer that caused the problem.  I like people who take ownership of a problem, and that includes the manager. My Cobb salad was great, not over-loaded with too much dressing and a very good value.  The vegetarian salad was good--I sampled it at dinner that night as a leftover.  We actually took two pizza boxes home with us, the leftover "wrong" pizza and a full correct pizza.  Everything was good. So, we will be back, even though it is a bit of a drive for us.  I do like a great salad.

Me and my husband stopped by here on our way back from the USAFA for lunch. Everything was delicious and the restaurant was clean. The wait staff was very friendly. We ordered their $30 deal that comes with an appetizer, two entrees, and a dessert. We also ordered a small plate that was not included in the deal. For the appetizer we got the sesame ginger chicken dumplings. They were really good but they give you so little and we were left wanting a bit more. For the entrees we ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and the four cheese with fresh tomatoes pizza. Both pizzas were delicious. They tasted very fresh. The small plate we ordered was the tortilla chips with white corn guacamole. Again, taste was good and the guacamole tasted fresh. The dessert we got was the chocolate soufflé. It was okay. I've had better to be honest but it was still good for the price. The only complaint I had was the price for drinks were $2.50 each which I thought was a bit much. That's pretty much it. All in all, we'll definitely be coming back with friends and family!

Ordered two pizzas, two salads...one pizza was perfect (the kids pizza). The other (pepporoni pizza) was raw dough in the middle...manager had the pizza re made and it was delicious. One of the salads was perfect (Cobb salad) the other was a Caesar salad with salmon....or croutons....not sure what they were actually. Manager had this salad re made also...and agreed the salmon chunks were crouton-like. The second attempt was good tho. Super slow service, very slow on the drink refills and food. I'm NEVER one to complain...but my family and I can confidently say we will never be eating here again. Sadly...usually CPK is delicious!!!

Recently ate at CPK for lunch with a group of people. We arrived a bit after 11 am on a week day. The restaurant was bigger than I expected it to be from the outside.  Inside is bright and open.  Our group was seated right away and our drink orders arrived quickly. I ordered a large Caesar Salad with chicken. The salad was huge and the lettuce seemed crisp and fresh. The dressing and the tender grilled chicken on the salad was just fine. I also ordered tiramisu for dessert which was delicious! It was really, really good. The only small hiccup with our service was that it seemed like it took longer than normal for our food to come out. And it seemed like we waited longer than we should have for our desserts.  We were just about ready to ask where our food was when it was brought out. Not too big of a deal.  Other than that everything else was smooth sailing. Our server was great.

Not a fan of this particular CPK's customer service.  We ordered online for curbside pickup. Once home we realized the order was incomplete.  Okay...no worries...things happen...lets just fix it.  After calling and being put on hold and then transferred a number of times, we were given what basically amounts to a shrug of shoulders. Not a fan of the lack of customer care.  We understand we aren't high rollers, but when your business depends on repeat customers and positive word of mouth and a positive reputation...even one bad experience is too much for a restaurant. Update:   The manager contacted me via Yelp,apologized for the experience and asked us to try them again. I have to say the second experience was 180 from the first. So glad I went back and so impressed with how my review was handled.     Ps... They had no idea who my family was when we went again. We were just another family eating dinner.

I have only been to this restaurant twice in my life both time at this location. I love this pizza place. I am gluten intolerant and was pleasantly surprised to see that they had a gluten free option! Not only was it labeled gluten free (like some places) but the restaurant has gone out of its way to get certified as gluten free. I love the flavor of the pizza and was very happy that the gluten free option was actually full of flavor unlike some gluten free options.  I have gladly recommended this place to family and they tok have enjoyed their time at cpk and are hoping to go back soon(we live about an hour away so won't be there often but it will for sure be on our list of stops when we are in town)
Love CPK! Great pizza and salad. GoWaiter of Colorado Springs delivers too!
Menu selections are excellent; something for everyone. Salads are awesome. Butter cake ala-mode is awesome. Pizza was subpar this time; usually better. Atmosphere is awesome.

I have been to CPK in Hawaii and California and this location has the slowest service that I have experienced. Furthermore, when we arrived here, the section we were sat in was empty. There are now 4 other families and after 40 minutes, two got their food before us. One of the two being an employee who came to eat before staring her shift. It 3pm and I can't imagine if we came during peak lunch or dinner.  Not coming here again when passing through!

Horrible management!  Went in to eat on a mid-afternoon on Saturday, it wasn't too busy.  The service was quite slow after we got in the door.  It was quite frustrating until I saw the reason - two people essentially covering the entire dining area.  The real frustration - seeing 5 other help staff sitting at the back tables eating and goofing around.  I thought it could just be their break, but they didn't move or help anyone the whole hour+ that we were there!  The hostess would sit back with them, only getting up in order to help the occasional person coming in.  On top of that, the manager then went and sat with them to eat!  I felt bad for out waitress since she was getting no help.  I understand giving the help a break, but an hour break when there's customers waiting to be served is not how to succeed in a business.  Certainly do not plan on coming back!

I've never had a bad dish at CPK! I come for their salads but nibble on pizza. I tried the Thai salad tonight and liked it a lot! Peanut sauce gave it a unique flavor.  I love the Caramelized Peach salad and you can not leave without trying the Salted Carmel Pudding.

I love coming to eat here. The pizza isn't what you'd get with a delivery place. It's much better. They have really creative pizzas among other things on their menu. I've never had bad service here and they are pretty quick getting your food out. I just tried the ginger chicken dumplings and they were incredible. My favorite pizza is the artichoke and spinach pizza, but I think I like their pasta even more. Definitely would recommend.

I have to say this place is pretty great. When we were seated our waiter was very kind and out going. His name was Gaylen. He did a good job checking on us and if we needed anything. He also gave us great recommendations for food items that me and my family loved which came out in a timely fashion.I would definitely come back and recommend this place.

Ate at CPK last night after hearing rants and raves from a store associate at Ulta and decided to give this a try. Customer service was fantastic and our waitress checked in on us and was very polite. The food was so so. Growing up with only getting pizza from either Domino's or Pizza Hut and a mushroom lover, I decided to get the hand tossed mushroom pizza. I LOVED the mixture of cheese, mushroom but it was nothing special. I did like how it wasn't ridiculously salty like most places. I sure didn't enjoy the cardboard pizza crust. CPK should offer more crust options. After eating I'm not sure if I'd go back again. I would say it's a hit or miss. There's nothing special about this place and the pizza was $12 and tasted like $8.00. Try this place at least once just to see what it is like. You might like it.
Unfortunately, I have to take this location to one star.  Over the past year, this location has been plagued by service and kitchen problems.
The food here is pretty good. If I'm on this side of town this is one of my main go-tos. Sometimes the service is a little in the slow side but overall still worth it.

I went to California Pizza Kitchen twice in one week because it was the place others chose to meet. I haven't been to one in years! I am very surprised by the negative reviews on the service here- I was highly impressed by the service from the hostess/greeter and the servers and even the manager who was walking around both times I was here.The service was personal, friendly, attentive, patient and very helpful each time- again, I was surprised by how good it was. The second time I was there the server from the first time came over and said hello and said "I remember you- you're nice!" which was so sweet. :) It also kind of made me look good in front of my new friends. ;) I also really really liked my food both times. The first time I had the Hawaiian pizza (and requested it be on thin crust which costs $1.50 more for some reason) and I can't believe I ate the whole thing! The second time I had the warm caramelized peach salad which was also very good. I recommend you sign up for their rewards card too- it sounds like it is worth it. Overall, I think this location is great and I will definitely be back! (And I can't wait to try some of their desserts- they look fantastic).

As far as chain or corporate restaurants go my husband and I really enjoy this place. I love that even though they are a pizza place they offer numerous gluten free selections. I just love their salad menu and there are several other items I can choose from. We've always had fantastic service and always notice a manager present running food or visiting tables which I think is commendable. Today we had two small plates of tortillas and corn guacamole and my husband had quesadillas. For entrees I had Moroccan Chicken Salad salad and my husband had the chicken club.  All the food was brought out rather promptly and we had plenty to take home. I will say the salad greens we're a bit wilted but nothing that I couldn't eat. my husband tried the mango non-alcoholic summer drink and it was refreshing and delicious! our server was Joshua and he was fantastic and friendly and knowledgeable! The one complaint is that it was incredibly almost unbearably cold and I noticed two other tables request to move because of the draft from the air conditioning so it seems that the management should know of this. And lastly they offer military discount so we enjoy any business that extends this courtesy! Otherwise we will soon again return there!

Pear&gargonzola pizza with arugala ! Such a wonderful thing. There is also the bbq chicken pizza with smoked goulda cheese.All their personal sized pizzas are cooked in a wood oven and are a million times better than the supermarket frozen version. Great collection of fusion noodle dishes.and "small plates" or tapas to share& nibble.I also love their house dressing ,a creamy basamic, on any salad . They have lovely wines, in lovely glasses = very " california".I find service is always top notch. Great for girls day or a   really cares if any thing goes wrong, but usually service & food is tip top.

Love this CPK. My wife and I have visited this location three times during our last two visits to Colorado Springs. This location has the same great food as other CPKs that we visit and top notch service too. On top of that, their current salad chef is a real artist. Our salads were beautifully prepared and presented.
It's been 8 years since I've been in a CPK and I expect it might be another 8 years before I go back.  I did have a cobb salad and it was good, but that's not a very high bar to clear.

This place is definitely hit or miss with service. The kitchen ALWAYS delivers though. I don't know who they have working the pizza oven but I have never been disappointed in the quality of food. Once again, the thing that gets me is the service. It's really slow, it takes a while to place an order. If you don't mind waiting, this is definitely a great place to eat dinner. Currently they have a seasonal strawberry short-cake dessert that is really good.

Awesome food awesome service gave me a coupon for a free small platter  Thank you Josh!!!! This is the best service I've had since I've been Colorado Springs  and Chris . Had to leave Cail to try this pizza Lol .

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. Its still chain food but its much better than anything else out there. If you're in the mood for 'fancy' pizza and you haven't tried California Pizza Kitchen, I'd say give it a go.

Absolutely terrible service by a waitress named Kati. Unprofessional and hardly checked on the table. She took our orders and that was it. Our avocado egg rolls had hair inside an egg roll, the general manager replaced the egg rolls and then brought out my barley soup, the spoon had dried up chocolate on the spoon, she told us she removed the avocado rolls off the ticket and included a 20% discount on the bill. When the bill came, the rolls were off the bill but no 20% discount so we had to wait longer for the manager to add the discount. So disappointing considering the CPK in Hawaii was exceptional and amazing! We will not be visiting this place ever again. What a shame!

I was a little disappointed in this visit.  I've come for years and my favorite pizza, shrimp scampi, was discontinued.  I know that happens but it's too bad. It was what I went for.  The service was average, to slightly below even though the people were friendly. I would come back if you bring back my favorite pizza!!! I may anyway :)

I am a CPK junkie for sure! Love that they carry La Crema Pinot Noir, as most "higher-end" restaurants in the Springs consider Castle Rock and Mirassou wine that should be sold above house wine status. Gross!  The arugula salad small plate is delicious with a meal, but the Waldorf is to die for and gigantic, a meal in itself! I always get the tequila chicken and it's soooo good. The salted caramel in the jar dessert is the only way to end a fabulous meal. It's a chain, but I love clean and consistent and their managers and staff are always accommodating and friendly!!

I ordered the Crispy Thin Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza for a pick up.  The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars, and not 1, is because I didn't experience their service, so I can't judge it on that. Judging it purely on the quality of my pizza, however, I should very much give them 1 star.  The Jamaican Jerk was certainly NOT crispy, it was very tough to chew, I literally had to grip it with my teeth and pull the pizza with my hand to try and break off a piece to eat. The taste of the pizza was disgusting. It's certainly not a pizza, and I'm not sure what it was trying to achieve. The "sauce" - and I do use that only as a place-holder word - was some sour mess that was so overbearing, when I tasted it in my pizza, I couldn't taste anything else till I reached the top crust.. The chicken had a weird, almost dirt-like, texture to it - but was strangely tasteless when I did manage to pluck a piece off to isolate it from that disgusting sauce.  I made it through one and a half pieces of this disgusting pizza before I threw it out. There goes $15. Maybe I caught them on an "off-day". It was Friday, and I'm sure the dinner rush was having an affect on the overall quality of food coming from the kitchen. However, I do have trouble believing, even on a good day, that the quality for this particular piece of pizza would be anywhere near enjoyable. Based on the food I experienced, I cannot recommend anyone to the CPK. As I said, the only reason I'm not giving this place a 1 star is because I can't judge their service.  Maybe their other items on the menu are different; I'll never pay another dollar to find out. Consider my business lost.

Rude restaurant manager! Will not be returning, brought in stroller for my infant child and toddler with broken leg , I asked if I could place it on the back wall behind our booth, was told yes that's fine. Restaurant manager asks to move it to the BACK of the restaurant 10min later saying its 'kinda in the way' it was NOT in the way of ONE customer or employee! There was three feet if not more between my stroller and the table across from it, he wants it back by the FILTHY bathrooms? Are you kidding me? It's an $800 stroller! This manager needs a training in customer service because he clearly has no clue what he's doing. Big bald guy in a FLANEL shirt, so professional (insert eye roll) if we hadn't been just served our appetizers and our drinks I wouldn't even have stayed to eat. Disgusted and I won't be stopping with this review I will be letting corporate know - unacceptable to treat people like that. My child has a broken leg and we need access to her things and I have a newborn... Aka comes with strollers and car seats. Ridiculous

Excellent food. They never disappoint! I think there is a line that shouldn't be crossed when it comes to employees and paying customers at the bar. Inappropriate to be texting and telling me about your life story while I'm trying to enjoy my lunch. Very JV! Other than that, duo lunch is amazing!

First off I ordered the pea barley soup. I think the chives added a good look to the plating and a semi acid flavor to contrast the savory soup. The bowl size is plenty but I would not recommend it for two people. The barley and carrots in the soup were cooked through and overall it came together well. When waiting to order our food we were given bread and an oil based dip. It's good to satisfy you if you're especially hungry on the given day you visit. Now the reason I gave this place three stars is due to our overall experience. Our waiter disappeared for a while and we had to ask another waiter to find her. After that ordeal, the steak was sub par(my friend recommends you don't get). The potatoes lacked the texture of a good steak and potatoes meal. Now the pizza and soup combo was average overall. Little Caesars makes better pizza because the bread was tough and a centimeter thick. However the soup was rich thick and creamy and it would be recommended on my friends part. 1/3 of us will not return.

My fiancé an I went to this location searching for a place that could accommodate some difficult allergy requests. From the moment we walked in the staff was right there to help. The hostess gave us special menus and ingredient list so we could check to see if any unfriendly ingredients were in the recipes. The manager even came over to our table to assist with ordering.  End of day this place gave us what we have had a hard to finding, a great place to eat and a place to go without having to worry about feeling sick after. Great food! Great service! We will be back!
Pretty California Pizza Kitchen. The food is good, not great. There is a nice selection. We like that we can find food adults and kids like. The service is pretty good as well.

I've loved cpk for years.  My wife and I would always have great experiences at cpk.  We went during non peak hours.  Wasn't very busy seating and service was quick and simple.  I ordered the traditional bbq chicken pizza with pineapple.  Again good timing not long for our pizza.   It wasn't upto what I think of as cpk standard. Under Cooked still doughy.  Pineapple didn't seem fresh and crisp.  If they can't get it right during slow times what chance do you have during the dinner rush? All these photos are professional food service photos ripped from the website.  Lame don't expect your food to look that good,  not at this location.

First time in long time - I had BBQ pizza, my guest had Pepperoni Pizza which was pretty good but pricy - with tip $45 for two.  Coke Products.  Service was fast and good.  Mgr stopped by to ask about service and food.  This location a bit difficult to find parking due to many other eating locations nearby.  Definite busy time at NOON so plan accordingly.

This CPK is not so great. Ordered the BBQ chicken salad and BBQ chicken pizza. Barely any toppings on the pizza which lacked flavor.l, and the salad didn't have any toppings nor flavor. Way over priced for amount of so so quality of food.  Where's the chicken? There was hardly any. No beans or corn in my salad. Would I come back to this CPK.? NNNNNOOOOOOOO.  Would I go back to a different CPK? Yes
Clean restaurant. Food is good. Staff is very friendly and attentive. Located in a nice shopping center. Still looks pretty new and is well maintained.

Staff went above and beyond for me. Food was good, server was fine, but AFTER we ate is when they showed some amazing consideration. I had met some friends while I was in town for the holidays and one brought my preserved wedding bouquet from the florist. It was in a simple vase and looked like some regular dead flowers but had been wrapped in part of my dress. Super sentimental object yet as we were leaving I was distracted left it behind. I was devastated when I realized I'd left it like a forgetful idiot. I was terrified it was sitting in a dumpster surrounded by trash and gone forever. I called just in case by some miracle they saved it, and they had! I couldn't believe it and cried on the phone to the nice woman who gave me the news. They could have easily tossed it and went the extra mile just in case. I cannot express my gratitude enough - whoever did all this deserves a major pat on the back.

You can tell immediately when a restaurant's staff truly enjoys working at their restaurant. Here, it is so readily obvious. This restaurant has such a great vibe, and this definitely comes across in the food, which has always been fresh and delicious. Each time I've been here the staff doesn't seem to just be doing their "job", but also truly seems to want to take care of us, their guests. Too many items to suggest, you literally cannot go wrong

Today  Worse service ever. They usually really good with our orders. But today it just sucks We been waiting for a salad for 20 minutes and still no here. I wanted to update my review so to the fact the manager came to us and apologize for the situation and took it care of it. So I have to said his response toward us is why  I am coming back some day to this restaurant. Thank you again

Prices are ridiculous. $15 for a medium bowl of salad that is nothing special. I don't mind spending more at a good restaurant for special dishes, but the dishes I've had here are below average and really small. Update 5/4/2017: Someone from CPK wants my contact info, but I don't know why they do that, except to give you a dessert or something to make you happier. When prices get near or above $15 for anything, it had better be excellent, not just run of the mill, which is what I've had there every time. We ate there right after they opened. The waitress kept saying it'll be ready soon, and then after 40 minutes she told us they lost the order. The next time I ate there, the pile of food was so small that the manager agreed to make me a whole new plate. Both together made one meal amount. We hadn't eaten there in a while (couple of years), and wanted something different, so we tried it again. The prices have gone up, if I remember right, and the amount and quality are simply disappointing.

This is a great go-to place for a good home cooked style pizza with a healthy flare. My daughter loves the BBQ chicken pizza. It is really good if I do say so myself. They also have a wide beverage selection. I've had a few different pizzas here, and they've all been great!  Although there's always been seating when I've come, one major complaint I have is that it seems to be an ice box inside more often than not. So, if you go, please remember your jacket no matter what time of year it is. You'll probably need it.  The service is good, but can be quite slow at times. Overall, the pizza is good, their salads are good. It's a bit on the pricy side. But, if you have time and a jacket, come in and grab some grub.

first time eating at this CPK, I've only been to the one in Hawaii. There was no wait here and that was nice because I'm so used to CPK being crowded and there always being a wait. The food was delicious as always and the drinks were yummy!!

I happened to see this place had shishito peppers while I was walking by. Those are a fav of my husband so I ordered some to go. My husband has been caring for me during chemo. Today was the first day I have been able to drive since my last treatment so it felt good to do something nice for him.  The order cost $7.57. There are 11 peppers in the box. I thought it was a half order. What a rip off.

Very nice service and kind employees. The manager blessed us with a free appetizer.  We got the lunch duo specials (all three of us did) and the salads were fresh and full of great flavor and the pizza was very delicious.  It's clean. Mild music (meaning not overpowering of conversations ). Cute decor. Simple and very enjoyable overall. And overall the whole area in which the restaurant is located is extremely nice.

I came to this CPK (which I normally frequent) with a couple of friends; they ordered a gluten free pizza which they've had at this location before, and when the food arrived their pizza was so undercooked that it was impossible to even pick up- it fell apart and flopped over, and was incredibly soggy. When the waitress came back, they politely explained the problem with their pizza and she responded that they'd "put it back in the oven." Then she brought it to the kitchen WHICH IS VISABLE FROM WHERE I SAT... and had a little complain session with the chef at which point he begrudgingly put the pizza back in the oven and then grumpily continued whatever he had been doing. When she returned, WITH THE SAME PIZZA (SANS THE MANGLED PIECE THEY HAD ATTEMPTED TO EAT), like she brought back the same pizza with one less piece, y'all, I'm so serious, the crust was very crispy, but the rest of the pizza was still floppy and soggy like it had spent the last six years aging in a sweaty armpit. The manager then came over (we didn't ask for her, she came over on her own), and when we explained the problem to her, she tried to say that the gluten free crust is always that way: it's not, we know this because we've had it before BUT EVEN IF THAT WERE TRUE, and it is "always that way," why would CPK be knowlingly servin' up HOT GARBAGE?! Like, if that's the case, y'all need a new recipe. She did not apologize but said she'd take it off our bill. My friends still received a bill for their sodas, but did not receive a code for a survey- so here I am. The rest of the interaction with our waitress was very uncomfortable. She did not offer dessert or ask us any other questions about the quality of our food. She did somehow manage to say the correct words ("have a good night" etc.) whilst simultaneously having the facial expression and tone of someone who's pet you'd just murdered. Ask anyone and they will tell you that I love CPK; I talk about how great the food is all the time and have, until tonight, had nothing but delightful experiences, but tonight's staff handled the situation so poorly, and made us feel so uncomfortable (and like we were somehow terrible people for not wanting to eat WET ARMPIT PIZZA) that I will have a difficult time returning or recommending this establishment to anyone in the near future.

I am super upset right now about the fact that this business works with the delivery service GRUBHUB and neither one of the services are willing to provide adequate customer service.  Here's the story:  I used the service tonight for my husbands birthday for my family of 6.  The order gets delivered after an hour and fifteen or so minutes which is normal because I'm a regular customer.  Everyone's food comes except mine, so here's the dilemma.  Either they remake all the food and re-deliver it which will be having my kids eating a lot later than i want, or the restaurant didn't make it and I still have the aforementioned problem, or the driver goes back and gets my food that's been sitting out for over 30 mins and then takes another 15 mins to get to me.  By that time it's not worth the $17.99 I paid for it.  So I'm watching my family eat at the dinner table without me on my husbands birthday.  This is unfortunate.  I called GRUBHUB to get a refund because the whole dinner is ruined and I paid over $120 for someone's mistake to ruin the night.  The solution I get and the only thing that could be done was a $17.99 refund for my plate only.  No refund for the $20 tip I left the driver either.  Under the circumstances of ruining someone's whole night California Pizza Kitchen should have bitten the bullet and made this right.  $17.99 is not enough to turn my night around.  I've spent a lot of money there in the past and I will not ever again.  This is an example of poor management training.  One happy customer will tell maybe a couple people about a great experience, but an upset customer on average will tell eleven people about their negative experience.  I guess this is why the movement is shifting to support local.  P.S.  GRUBHUB states that only California Pizza Kitchen can issue the refund for my bill.

This was my second time eating at CPK. Their salads are very good. The food carries a heavy herb taste. Not something that my pallet necessarily agrees with. They have fun menu ideas that for me just don't arouse my pallet. Overall good service, okay menu.
